property.name: ServicePortMatchRegexp
property.summary: A PCRE to match web service port
property.description: Specify a PCRE as the match criteria to identify the web services port. When the PCRE matches a Service Port in WSDL, the rewrite rules is applied.

property.name: LocalEndpointProtocol
property.description: Select the protocol portion of the rewritten web service binding used by the local endpoint. The protocol can be different from the one in the WSDL.

property.name: LocalEndpointHostname
property.description: Specify the URL protion of the rewritten web service binding that specifies the host name or IP address. A value of 0.0.0.0 indicates that the Web Service Proxy listens on all of the interfaces. Alternatively, you can specify a Host Alias.

property.name: LocalEndpointPort
property.description: Specify the URL portion of the rewritten web service binding that specifies the port. If 0, uses the value from the WSDL.
Specify the URL portion of the rewrriten web service binding that specifies the local path. If not specified, uses the value that is specified in the WSDL.
property.name: LocalEndpointURI
FrontProtocol
property.description: Select the Front Side Handler to use to determine the IP address, port, and protocol.
Use a Front Side Handler to determine the IP address, port, and protocol for matching WSDL service port. Selecting this mode overrides these values in this rewrite rule.
property.name: UseFrontProtocol

property.description: Specify the WSDL binding protocol to use in the rewritten Web service.
property.name: WSDLBindingProtocol

property.display: Local Endpoint WSDL Port Name Suffix
property.description: Specify a suffix to add to the name of the WSDL port that will be used to represent this service endpoint in the rewritten Web service. If empty, rewrite the original port. The original port can only be rewritten once.
property.name: FrontsidePortSuffix
property.summary: Local Endpoint WSDL Port Name Suffix

property.name: ServicePortMatchRegexp
property.summary: A PCRE to match web service port
property.description: Specify a PCRE as the match criteria to identify the web services port. When the PCRE matches a Service Port in WSDL, the rewrite rules is applied.
Select the protocol portion of the rewritten web service binding used by the remote endpoint. The protocol can be different from the one in the WSDL.
property.name: RemoteEndpointProtocol
RemoteEndpointHostname
property.description: Specify the URL portion of the rewritten web service binding that specifies the host name or IP address. If not specified, uses the value from the WSDL.

property.name: RemoteEndpointPort
property.description: Specify the URL portion of the rewritten web service binding that specifies the port. If 0, uses the value from the WSDL.

Specify the URL portion of the rewritten web service binding that specifies the remote path. If not specified, the value from the location attribute of the soap:address element in the WSDL is used. For the IBM MQ, TIBCO EMS, and WebSphere JMS protocols, the URI must specify a RequestQueue parameter. For most web services, the ReplyQueue parameter is required to receive the SOAP response.
property.name: RemoteEndpointURI
RemoteMQQM
property.description: Specify the URL portion of the rewritten web service binding that specifies IBM MQ Queue Manager. Required when remote server is IBM MQ.

property.name: RemoteTibcoEMS
property.description: Specify the URL portion of the rewritten web service binding that specifies Tibco EMS. Required when remote server is Tibco EMS.

property.name: RemoteWebSphereJMS
property.description: Specify the URL portion of the rewritten web service binding that specifies WebSphere JMS. Required when remote server is WebSphere Application Server.

property.name: ServicePortMatchRegexp
property.summary: A PCRE to match web service port
property.description: Specify a PCRE as the match criteria to identify the web services port. When the PCRE matches a Service Port in WSDL, the rewrite rules is applied.
Select the protocol portion of the rewritten web service binding used by the publish endpoint. The protocol can be different from the one in the WSDL.
property.name: PublishedEndpointProtocol

property.description: Specify the URL portion of the rewritten web service binding that specifies the host name or IP address.
property.name: PublishedEndpointHostname
PublishedEndpointPort
property.description: Specify the URL portion of the rewritten web service binding that specifies the port. If 0, uses the value from the WSDL.
Specify the URL portion of the rewritten web service binding that specifies the local path. If not specified, uses the value from the WSDL.

object.name: WSEndpointRewritePolicy
object.summary: Create or edit WS Endpoint Rewrite Policies

property.name: mAdminState
property.label: Enable administrative state
property.summary: Set the administrative state of this configuration.
property.hoverhelp: <p>Set the administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set the check box.</li><li>To make inactive, clear the check box.</li></ul>
property.description: <p>The administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set to enabled.</li><li>To make inactive, set to disabled.</li></ul>

Add, edit, or delete a local endpoint rewrite rule. These rules evaluate services in a deployed WSDL file and specify the URL the appliance should use locally for matched services. They convert addresses in WSDL files to local endpoints.
property.name: WSEndpointLocalRewriteRule

property.description: Add, edit, or delete a remote endpoint rewrite rule. These rules evaluate services in deployed WSDL file and specify the URL the appliance should use remotely for matched services. They convert address in WSDL files to remote endpoints.
property.name: WSEndpointRemoteRewriteRule

property.description: Add, edit, or delete a publish endpoint rewrite rule. These rules evaluate services in deployed WSDL file and specify the URL the appliance should publish when producing its own WSDL files. Use this if you wish to publish an address different from the local address, for example the address of a load balancer in front of appliance.
property.name: WSEndpointPublishRewriteRule

property.description: Add, edit, or delete a subscription rewrite rule.
property.name: WSEndpointSubscriptionLocalRule

property.description: Add, edit, or delete a subscription rewrite rule.
property.name: WSEndpointSubscriptionRemoteRule

property.description: Add, edit, or delete a subscription rewrite rule.
property.name: WSEndpointSubscriptionPublishRule

object.description: Create or edit WS Endpoint Rewrite Policy
